alert.note: Alert for Brazos; Burleson; Grimes; Madison; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 28 at 6:12PM CDT until April 28 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR BURLESON...NORTHERN GRIMES...BRAZOS...CENTRAL WASHINGTON AND SOUTHWESTERN MADISON COUNTIES... At 611 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles east of Kurten to near Snook to near Dime Box, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Broadcast media reported power lines and trees down in northern Brazos County due to the strong winds. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... College Station, Bryan, Navasota, Caldwell, Somerville, Snook, Kurten, Burton, Wixon Valley, Millican, Lake Somerville Dam, Lake Somerville State Park & Trailway, Kyle Field, Bryan Utilities Lake, Iola, Carmine, Lyons, Deanville, Independence and Quarry. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
